tool.name: Prepare Data for REVIGO
tool.description: Cut columns from tabular data and define as REVIGO datatype.
tool.command: #if $comments: #if ($comments.char == "#"): awk 'NF && $1!~/^#/' $input | #end if #if ($comments.char == "//"): awk 'NF && $1!~/^\/\//' $input | #end if #else awk '{ print }' $input | #end if #if ($include_numeric.include_numeric_column == "yes"): awk '{ print \$goTermsCol"\t"\$numberCol}' goTermsCol=$goTermsCol numberCol=$include_numeric.numberCol > $out_file1 #else awk '{ print \$goTermsCol}' goTermsCol=$goTermsCol > $out_file1 #end if

param.name: ignore_comments
param.label: Ignore comments?
param.help: Also removes blank lines, which won't affect REVIGO results

tool.help:
Prepare data for the `REduce and VIsualize Gene Ontology (REVIGO) tool <http://revigo.irb.hr>`_.
This tool allows the user to select up to two columns from a tabular dataset, a column of Gene Ontology (GO) terms and a column of p-values or other numerical values.
Then, the tool defines the data as the 'revigo' datatype, which makes the REVIGO visualization appear in the Visualizations drop-down menu (the bar chart) in a history item. This will paste the desired data into the text field on the REVIGO website.
